tags.name: Adjikpo Yokunya Roman Catholic School (Mount Mary College of Education demonstration school)
Voice Of The Lord Basic School
The Morning Star International High School

tags.description: SDA Senior High was established in 2001 as a private day school in Asokore Koforidua. The school was absorbed into the Public system in 2010.
tags.name: SDA Senior High School, Koforidua
St. Peters Catholic Church Basic Schools

tags.description: Established in 1949 by Dr Alex Ansah Kofi of the Ekumide family of Ahenease, Larteh-Akuapem, initially it was called Larteh National Secondary School.
tags.name: Benkum Senior High School

tags.description: The school was established on 22nd September, 1961 and named Tafo Kukurantumi Secondary School. The name was later, in 1965, changed to Ofori Panin Secondary after the then Okyehene, Nana Ofori Panin. The first headmaster was Mr. Kweku Adwedaa.
tags.name: Ofori Panin Senior High School
Talent Creche, Early Childhood Development Centre

tags.description: The school is located in the New Juaben District, Koforidua.
tags.name: New Juaben Senior High/Commercial School

tags.description: It is a Technical and Science School nestled in a conducive academic environment with highly disciplined students and staff.
tags.name: Koforidua Senior High/Technical School

tags.description: To train students to excel academically, be morally upright and well-disciplined youth by the time they complete their course of studies in the school.
tags.name: Pope John's Senior High School & Minor Seminary

tags.description: Krobo Girls Senior High is a Presbyterian school situated at the western part of Odumase Krobo, about one kilometre off the Odumase-Asesewa road. It started as Krobo Girls Middle School, which was founded by few female Scottish Missionaries in March 1927.
tags.name: Krobo Girls Senior High School

tags.description: The school is both day and boarding and a co- educational institution. It was formally Akro Experimental Junior Secondary School which was upgraded to a Senior Secondary Technical in 1991.
tags.name: Akro Senior High/Technical School

tags.description: The School was established in 1943 and is one of the top schools in the Eastern Region. GHANAASS, the beacon of the East.
tags.name: Ghana Senior High School, Koforidua

tags.description: It is a community based school that serves the villages around Akropong. The school is mainly supported by the Brotherhood and the PTA. It boasts of a conducive environment for academic work.
tags.name: H'Mount Sinai Senior High School

tags.description: A Technical school offering Fashion, Catering, Electrical Engineering, Building Construction, Entrepreneurship at Adukrom Akuapem.
tags.name: J. G. Knol Vocational/Technical Institute

tags.description: Klo-Agogo Senior High school is a Government Assisted co-educational institution. It was founded in January 1991. It is about 80 Kilometres drive from Somanya and about 7 Kilometres from Boti Falls.
tags.name: Klo-Agogo Senior High School

tags.description: A Technical school with conducive learning atmosphere, very close to Cocobod Regional Head Office with a hands- on practical education.
tags.name: Koforidua Technical Institute

tags.description: Provision of standard education to the deaf by equipping them with academic, moral, vocational and social skills, using specialised human and material resources that inure to the benefit of students and the society.
tags.name: Mampong Akwapim Senior High/Technical School For The Deaf

tags.description: The School is in Tetteh Kofi New Mangoase 13km from Adawso on the Koforidua-Mamfe road. The school can also be reached from Nsawam through Pakro or Suhum.
tags.name: Mangoase Senior High School

tags.description: The school started as a private Mixed Secondary School in 1988, known as Mamfe State College but was handed over to the Methodist Church and later renamed Methodist High School.
tags.name: Methodist Girls' Senior High School, Mamfe

tags.description: The first batch of seventy (70) students, all boys, was enrolled on 16th October 1971.
tags.name: Nifa Senior High School

tags.description: Okuapeman Schl was established in 1957 by Maxwell Kwaku Opoku Akyeampong to fill the void of a secondary school in the Akuapem State. The government of Ghana took over the school in 1958 and absorbed it into the Public system.
tags.name: Okuapeman Senior High School

tags.description: The school is on the new Abirem to Nkawkaw Road opposite the market and lorry park.
tags.name: Oti Boateng Senior High School

tags.description: The school was established in 1989 by the Methodist Church in collaboration with the Traditional Council of Oyoko.
tags.name: Oyoko Methodist Senior High School

tags.description: PENSEC-Koforidua exists to offer holistic secondary education, backed by sound Christian education, to the youth of this nation and beyond, with qualified and committed staff.
tags.name: Pentecost Senior High School, Koforidua

tags.description: To provide relevant education to all Ghanaians at all levels to enable them to acquire skills that will assist them to develop their potentials.
tags.name: Presbyterian Senior High/Technical School, Larteh

tags.description: The Presbyterian Senior High school, Mampong Akuapem, was established in 1991 with only nine (9) students in the premises of then Middle Girl’s School after it was phased out under the Government Educational Reforms Programme.
tags.name: Presbyterian Senior High School, Mampong Akuapem

tags.description: The school was established in 1991. The school is situated at Adukrom-Akuapem near the Presbyterian Church building.
tags.name: Presbyterian Senior High/Technical School, Adukrom

tags.description: St. Paul Technical School was the first Technical School established in Ghana by the Divine Word Missionaries in 1957 at Kukurantumi - Akim in the Eastern Region of Ghana.
tags.name: St. Paul's Technical School

tags.description: The Yilo Krobo Senior High School, Somanya, was established by well-meaning citizens of the community in 1964 as a private commercial school and named Somanya Secondary School
tags.name: Yilo Krobo Senior High/Commercial School

tags.description: Ghanata Senior High School, formerly called the Gold Coast People College, was founded as a national co-educational institution on the 3rd February, 1936 at Adidome in the Volta Region by Rev, Isaac Doe Osabutey-Aguedze and Rev. F.K. Fiawoo.
tags.name: Ghanata Senior High School
